RELS1102 
He loooooves to talk about his travel abroad and the "natives" he's met/their perceived "peculiarities". talked a lot about how Native Americans are very diverse and should be studied, and how they have many different religions- said they shouldn't be called indians (obviously) but then called them indians for the rest of the semester.
This was a good and easy class but he is a tough grader when it comes to midterm, final, and class participation grade.

We had 13 biweekly writings (2-3 paragraphs that aren't super demanding), a midterm and final which you have half of the semester to work on answering 14-15 questions the same way you did the biweekly writings, and a presentation. As long as you try it should be easy. BUT I think if you don't have sm passion in asia, it'll be hard (CS major here)

I really enjoyed this class, I do feel I have learned more about different asian cultures from his lectures.This is a hybrid class so we meet once a week. Homework wasn't hard, just have it turned in on time. There are short anwsered online tests which has five questions, but he provides study guides. Overall manageable and easy if you do the work.

I took Dr.Paracka for RELS 1102! He is amazing and very caring and lenient, take him! There is a group project and an analytical paper due later in the semester. The first 9 weeks are video reflections and quizzes, nothing hard or overwhelming!

Don't get me wrong, the professor is a great guy, but he is zooming through slides so fast that it is hard to understand. Then the readings are so long and confusing that I can never get an A on the reflections no matter how hard I try or how much I read and reflect on. I see myself failing for the first time.

He is the best professor I have had so far. I loved how he teaches and the second half of the semester is spent on students' presentations. Short 5 question tests, he gives a 10 question study guide with exact questions from the test. No final exam.

Reading reflections and video reflections due every week. Very easy to do. He also responds and gives amazing feedback. Lectures are boring but he is very passionate about what he teaches. He takes attendance. Tests are open notes and he gives study guides exactly like the test. Overall, he is a very caring person and wants students to pass.
